title: Why are we punished for client faults?
body:
I got a game today, which was pretty balanced and in my opionion we would have won. But then suddenly all of my teammembers disconnected. Coincidence? Guess not. Because 3 teammembers of the enemy team disconnected too, at the exact same time. So finally the enemy team finished 2v1 against me. This is not the first time something like this happened. In the end I lost 20 LP for a game we would probably have won.

The Point is, I invest/ed a lot (money and time) in this game and I can't see why the players are punished for those technical problems. I just can't understand why there is still no concept which is able to detect such faults caused by the client... 

I guess I'm not the only one with this thoughts and i feel kinda mad about this topic.

What do you guys think about that? I just cant believe there is no possibility to handle this properly.

replies.body: Well League of Legends is still in beta. So expect bugs.
I love this comment
Just because you have invested $ and time into this game doesn't mean you will be prioritized over others. If you get punished for it, file a support ticket.
I dont want to be prioritized over others ;)

He didn't ask to be prioritized over others. I agree with him completely. He, nor his team, shouldn't be punished for something that was out of the control of literally everyone. Looking at his situation, the problem they had wasn't an individual's internet connection, but a server problem which is something Riot is in control of. If Riot caused a problem of that level, they should, at the very least, make the current game not count towards anything.
Pretty sure they do something like that- I don't play Ranked (much- although others try to make me) but I've seen it be disabled when problems are going.

Yea, I've seen it disabled also. I get that that's to prevent more people from playing ranked while they're having problems. But, how do you help the people that were already in matches when the problem first started? If they're already a system for this type of problem then I didn't know about it.

Punished is the wrong word.  You're not being punished by the client, or by Riot, or by anything really.

I don't know what word you're looking for to describe a client problem negatively effecting you, but punishment has nothing to do with it.

inflict a penalty or sanction on (someone) as retribution for an offense, especially a transgression of a legal or moral code.
"I have done wrong and I'm being punished for it"
synonyms:	discipline, teach someone a lesson; More
inflict a penalty or sanction on someone for (such an offense).
"fraudulent acts would be punished by up to two years in prison"
treat (someone) in an unfairly harsh way.
"a rise in prescription charges would punish the poor"

Punished fits quite well actually

No, it doesn't.

Can you please describe who is inflicting the retributive actions here?  What offense did the OP make?  What legal, moral, or ToS rule did he break?

No one is punishing him, and he didn't do anything wrong.  It doesn't fit.
the game itself would be the punisher, the punishment is the loss of lp.

Still doesn't explain what he did wrong, which is of course nothing.

Saying the game is punishing him is just a cop out.  Sorry mate.
you don't have to do something wrong to be punished... hence the "why are we being punished" you SHOULDN'T be punished for not doing anything wrong, but you still CAN.

Maybe not something "wrong", but you do have to do something.  He didn't do anything, no entity wanted retribution, and so it doesn't fit.

Sorry mate, but the definition doesn't agree with you.
You just have poor comprehension skills my friend.
Just ignore him lol.

I'm not actually trying to troll or anything.  When I look at the definition provided and what the OP said I don't see it working out.  The definition seems to require something to do the punishing in order for someone to be punished.

Saying a game or bug is capable of punishing someone simply makes no sense to me unless it's a specific system designed to punish players.

Imagine how it looks to me.  Everything seems to make sense one way, and yet everyone else is saying the exact opposite.

I'm all ears if someone can explain to me how a bug is capable of punishing someone.  Truly I am.
LP loss = being punished.

The LP loss is an unnecessary penalty to the player, no one is going to say otherwise.

All I said is that punished is the wrong word for the situation and the definition seems to back me up.

Punishment: the infliction or imposition of a penalty as retribution for an offense.

penalty*

you mentioned that word in that post.

ethier you're dumb or you're trolling.

So if there's a five and a seven year old in a house, and the five year old breaks something, but the seven year old gets grounded for it because he was there, do you not think the seven year old is being punished for something out of his control?

The point is that he didn't do anything wrong, and the system is punishing him because of what happened with another person. If you need another example, it's like if a murderer framed you for his work and you went to jail. You're wrongfully punished right?

As with most people who keep coming by this thread to post you're missing what we're actually talking about here.

There's no doubt he was penalized, but the word punish implies an entity to do the punishing and intent to actually punish someone for a reason.  It doesn't have to be a good reason, but there does have to be a reason.

That's what this argument was originally about, before people came in to post without fully reading the conversation.  At least the OP and I were on the same page after a single back and forth.

He was going to win, but lost it because of a sudden crashing of 7 players, the higher end being his. The client doesn't understand because a higher up didn't come in to forgive OP.

That's all I'm saying. That punished IS the right word.

I'll face it when someone actually reads what I'm saying and makes an attempt to help me get over the one detail I'm stuck on, which I've pointed out myself.  Until then I'm going to ignore assholes like you who would rather ignore me and insult me than read what I'm saying and look at how [this](http://www.dictionary.com/browse/punish?s=t) definition does not fit the situation the OP is talking about.

It's clearly a penalty, but it's not being inflicted upon him in a way that makes "punished" an accurate word.

Do you not realize that I've been yelled at, insulted, and ridiculed off of what I felt was a simple observation?

The entire reason I made my first post here was because I did not think the definition fit the context of the OP's post.  That detail, at the very least, should be blatantly apparent to you.

We disagree with one another.  Tough shit.  Can we let this thread die already?

The wrong doing is losing, which results in LP loss. It's a pretty easy concept to understand, and the fact that you cannot is quite laughable.

We're talking about what the OP, as a player, did wrong, not what was done to him that is wrong.  Unless you're saying his wrong doing was losing the match, which is complete nonsense, you missed something.

Some are definitely from people who know this argument is about semantics, but based on some of the replies there are definitely people who skimmed the thread and made bad assumptions.

Oh you did an excellent job at explaining. pretty much everyone here understood you perfectly.

> Can you please describe who is inflicting the retributive actions here? What offense did the OP make? What legal, moral, or ToS rule did he break?

It's a penalty, not a punishment.
Yeah, it may be that punished is the wrong word here, but in the end i feel kinda updet that there is still no fault detection which handels this properly.

fault detection would open up an abuseable window for cheating. it happens very infrequently... it's unfortunate, but considering it typically takes two years to make it to diamond+ I'd say it's something I'm willing to accept.

That sounds like an internet routing issue, not a game client issue.
While Riot has done a lot to set up their internet infrstructure, there are still things that are out of their control. Perhaps an accident occured (hardware faikure, ddos, whatever else) and internet traffic was rerouted and got bottlenecked.

Yeah it sucks when you get ounished for things out of your control, but you have to look and make sure the blame is placed correctly.

It may be worth emailing player support about the incident, but if they can't/don't help you then there's really nothing that can be done about it.  For all they know, someone could get their team to leave/disconnect in the hopes of not losing LP.

I am pretty sure the support wont do anything about that, cause a friend of mine once got a similar case and the support replied to him that they wont refund any lp and that he should go duo Q to get LP faster.
And yeah someone could force players to leave games but not 5 player at one time. And finally theres a difference between leaving a game or getting disconnected and trying to reconnect.

Yes, there is a difference, but they can't tell, can they?
Also I just meant about the people on your team leaving/disconnecting.
They could detect this indeed!
How?

There are several ways to do such things. In this special case it would be very easy, cause it wont happen that 5 people will leave.
To check if there are leavers in one team one could simply check if they left at the same second or ms and are not in the same connection or/and premade checks, etc.... But there would be several techniques and checks they could implement to check this out.
Indeed you can not assure that all cases are detected but at least some.

Riot will always be stingy about remakes of forgiveness because they fear that people will abuse the system and encourage toxicity. 

Also, Riot likely has enough tools to determine if the fault is on their end, in which they will turn on loss forgiven. If Just about Everyone DC just as you were about to win, in a ranked match. That actually makes me fear that drop hacking is back.

I believe a fix for this system would be if Riot would have a detector that would mark if someone willingly exited the game, like actually going through that 5 second exit process, rather than being immediately ejected from the game due to crashes or computer malfunctions. That way they can tell the diff by those who go afk or those who are ejected unwillingly out of the game.
